description: From Latin deprehendere, deprehensum, from de- + prehendere (“to lay hold of, seize”). See prehensile.

verbs.description: deprehend (third-person singular simple present deprehends, present participle deprehending, simple past and past participle deprehended)

entries.meaning: To take unawares or by surprise; to catch or seize (a criminal etc.) in the act.
To detect; to discover; to find out.
